content.description: An object is released from rest near the surface of a planet. The velocity of the object as a function of time is expressed in the following equation.
content.question: <math alttext="v sub y equals, open parenthesis, negative 3 meters per second squared, close parenthesis, times t" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> All frictional forces are considered to be negligible. What distance does the object fall <math alttext="10 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> after it is released from rest?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
